Header: Czech doctors deliver baby girl 117 days after mother’s brain-death
Content: When a helicopter rushed an unconscious Czech woman who had suffered a severe stroke to hospital in April, her chances of survival were slim and those of the fetus she had carried in her womb for 15 weeks were not much better. And yet, on August 15, against all odds, a healthy baby girl was born by cesarean section weighing 2.13 kg and measuring 42 cm to her brain-dead mother. The success of the delivery would not have been possible without the support of the child’s family. Ventruba added that the girl was now in the care of her father, grandmother, and aunt.
